info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 4 at 10:22PM EDT until April 7 at 4:13AM EDT by NWS Louisville KY
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana...
Blue River at Fredericksburg affecting Washington and Harrison Counties.
.Heavy rain from the past few days will cause the river to rise.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Blue River at Fredericksburg.
* WHEN...Until early Monday morning.
* IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Water covers parts of Fredericksburg-Depauw Road near river. At 22.0 feet, Backroads in town flood. Water approaches US 150. At 23.0 feet, US 150 is closed.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:30 PM EDT Friday the stage was 19.7 feet. - Bankfull stage is 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 23.5 feet Sunday morning. It will then fall below flood stage late Sunday evening. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 23.3 feet on 02/19/2000. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk.
The next statement will be issued by Saturday afternoon at 200 PM EDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY MONDAY MORNING
